Epicurean | website = {{URL|zeenaschreck.com}} }} '''Zeena Schreck''' (born '''Zeena Galatea LaVey''', November 19, 1963), known professionally by her [[Mononymous person|mononymous]] artist name '''ZEENA''',<ref>{{cite web|title=2013 Performa-13 Art Exhibit describes Zeena Schreck as "known by her mononymous artist name, ZEENA."|url=http://13.performa-arts.org/event/frank-haines-zeena-schreck}}</ref> is a [[Berlin]]-based American visual and musical artist, author and the spiritual leader of the Sethian Liberation Movement (SLM), which she founded in 2002.
Raised within her father's organization, the [[Church of Satan]], she came to international prominence early in life as the Church's first [[spokesperson]], defending the organization during the 1980s. In 1990 she resigned her position, severed ties with her father [[Anton LaVey]] and his Church, and renounced the [[LaVeyan Satanism|church's]] [[Dogma|tenets]]. Since that time, her religion changed to [[Buddhism]] and she is now a teacher of [[Vajrayana|Tibetan Tantric Buddhism]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Professional description in biography: "She is a practicing Tibetan Buddhist yogini, teaches at the Buddhistische Gesellschaft Berlin"|url=http://13.performa-arts.org/artists/zeena-schreck}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Beelzebub's Daughter: How Zeena Schreck left the Church of Satan|url=https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/yv53ex/beelzebubs-daughter-0000175-v19n4}}</ref>
==Early years and family==
Zeena was born in San Francisco, California to [[Anton LaVey]] (April 11, 1930 – October 29, 1997), and [[Diane Hegarty]] (b. July 10, 1942), co-founders of the [[Church of Satan]]. On May 23, 1967, three-year-old Zeena had the first and most highly publicized Satanic baptism in history performed by her father.<ref>{{cite web|title=Clip of 1989 Sally Jesse Raphael Halloween Show with Zeena Schreck providing a concise explanation of what her Satanic baptism was; begin at 01:40:|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=exWUeQ53ICg}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.gettyimages.de/license/515036094|title=Editorial & News Images: News Photography, Pictures, Awards, Events, Sports, Celebrity Photos - Getty Images|publisher=}}</ref> The ceremony garnered worldwide publicity with a reenactment of the ceremony recorded for ''[[The Satanic Mass]]'' LP.<ref>{{cite web|title=The Satanic Mass/Zeena's Baptism Track A9 go to 3:42|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s_M09vuLQAc}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=The Satanic Mass, Track A9 (Zeena's Baptism)|url=http://www.discogs.com/Anton-LaVey-The-Satanic-Mass/release/1166426|publisher=Murgenstrumm, 1968 Vinly LP}}</ref>
Zeena was subjected to hundreds of journalistic reports and interviews especially in tabloid crime and men's magazines.<ref>{{cite web|title=Media coverage of the child Zeena|url=http://www.zeena.eu/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=109%3Apress-coverage-of-zeenas-baptism-1967-1968&catid=41&Itemid=57}}</ref> Anton LaVey biographer, Burton H. Wolf described a thirteen-year-old Zeena in his introduction to her father's ''[[The Satanic Bible]]'' as "Zeena, remembered by people who saw the famous photo of the Satanic Church baptism as a tiny tot, but now a gorgeously developed teenager attracting a growing pack of wolves, human male variety."<ref>{{cite web|title=The Satanic Bible (ref. introduction)|url=http://www.home.no/theriksen/The%20Satanic%20Bible.pdf|publisher=Avon Books}}</ref> In an interview with ''The Guardsman'', she describes becoming a mother at the age of fourteen while living in "a stifling, dysfunctional family life."<ref>{{cite web|title=Zeena Schreck advocates free education|url=http://theguardsman.com/zeena-schreck-advocates-free-education/}}</ref><ref name="vice mag 1 ">{{cite web|title=Beelzebub's Daughter|url=https://www.vice.com/en_uk/read/beelzebubs-daughter-0000175-v19n4|work=Vice Magazine|publisher=Vice Media Inc|accessdate=26 July 2012|author=Annette Lamothe-Ramos}}</ref>
==Early artistic influences and training==
Zeena's work as a photographer, visual artist, musician/composer and writer are heavily influenced by mystical and magical traditions. Stylistically, she gravitated at an early age to artists and mentors whose art were also imbued by a mystical or magical vision.
As a teenager and young adult, she trained in and studied theater, drama and film. At sixteen years of age, Zeena passed the [[HSED|High School equivalency exam]], which enabled her to leave High School early, begin working legally and enroll in [[City College of San Francisco]], majoring in Drama.<ref>{{cite web|title=Interview with Zeena Schreck for The Guardsman, SF City College Newspaper|url=http://theguardsman.com/zeena-schreck-advocates-free-education/}}</ref> In addition to [[City College of San Francisco|CCSF]]'s Drama Department, she also received instruction from [[Stella Adler Studio of Acting]], [[Eric Morris (actor)|Eric Morris]] acting coach, [[Viola Spolin]]'s student Marcia Kimmell of The Next Stage Improvisation Theater San Francisco, and the [[American Conservatory Theater|San Francisco School of Dramatic Arts]]. Her study focus was [[Theatre of ancient Greece|Hellenic sacred drama]], [[Improvisational theatre|improvisation]], and various branches of the [[Konstantin Stanislavski|Stanislavski]] [[Stanislavski's system|'system']] and [[method acting]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Zeena Schreck: Theatrical Appearances/Training|url=http://www.zeena.eu/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=70&Itemid=84}}</ref>
The importance of lineage as a vehicle for passing down metaphysical energy guides Zeena's ritual art. She traces the lineage of her magical art to the [[mentorship]] of her [[godparent|godfather]], filmmaker [[Kenneth Anger]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Art/Photography Overview about Zeena|url=http://www.zeena.eu/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=88&Itemid=53}}</ref> During the 1960s and 1970s, Anger transmitted the influences of [[Curtis Harrington]], [[Jean Cocteau]], and [[Maya Deren]] on his own work to Zeena during her childhood and adolescence.<ref>{{cite web|title=Filmed interview with Zeena describing Kenneth Anger's influence on Zeena's early developmental years.|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hurX8Tp3Mys}}</ref>
Zeena also became a long-time friend of [[Film director|director]] Curtis Harrington, who cast her as a [[Marlene Dietrich|Dietrich]]-like character in his last film, ''Usher'' (2000).<ref>{{cite web|title=Vice article: Remembering Curtis Harrington and His Films|url=https://www.vice.com/read/remembering-curtis-harrington-and-his-films}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=House of Harrington: video documentary including clips from 'Usher'|url=https://vimeo.com/12090059}}</ref>
==Religious groups==
In 1985, Zeena became the High Priestess of the Church of Satan, and remained its spokesperson until 1990.<ref>{{cite web|title=Ref. Zeena became the High Priestess of the Church of Satan in 1985.[...]In 1990, Zeena left the Church of Satan and renounced her father's teachings of LaVeyan Satanism.|url=http://www.rebelcircus.com/blog/conspiracy-theorists-say-taylor-swift-clone-famous-satanist/|publisher=Rebel Circus}}</ref> She would later become a devotee of the ancient Egyptian deity [[Set (deity)|Set]], becoming High Priestess of the Temple of Set in 2002, and forming the Sethian Liberation Movement later that same year.<ref>{{cite web|title=VICE Magazine interview ref.|url=https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/yv53ex/beelzebubs-daughter-0000175-v19n4|publisher=Vice Magazine}}</ref>
Interviews, articles and reviews between 2011-2013 referenced her conversion to [[Tibetan Buddhism|Tibetan Tantric Buddhism]] in the [[Drikung Kagyu|Drikung]], [[Karma Kagyu]] and [[Nyingma]] lineages, as well as her status as the spiritual leader of the Sethian Liberation Movement (SLM).<ref>{{cite web|title=Article from Nov. 22, 2013 states, "Zeena is a practicing Tibetan Buddhist yogini (in the Drikung, Karma Kagyu and Nyingma lineages), so the disappointed Satanist's query might seem strange to those unaware of her history."|url=http://bushwickdaily.com/bushwick/categories/arts-and-culture/1807-the-left-hand-path-leads-to-performa-13|website=Bushwick Daily|publisher=Bushwick Daily}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Nightwatch Radio archive of Zeena Schreck interview: Episode 12-27-11|url=http://www.zombiebloodbath.com/nightwatch/nw-archives.html|website=Zombie Blood Bath/Nightwatch|ref=Episode 12-27-11}}</ref>
===Church of Satan===
In the 1980s in the United States, there was a [[moral panic]] about [[Satanic ritual abuse]], sometimes referred to as the "Satanic Panic". It started with the publication of the now-discredited memoir ''[[Michelle Remembers]]'' in 1980, and culminated in the [[McMartin preschool trial]], a heavily publicized trial which ran from 1984 to 1990, during which prosecutors, through aggressive and [[leading question]]s, managed to get over 300 of the preschool's children to testify that they had been sexually abused by their teachers as part of Satanic rituals. The charges were all eventually dropped. Media coverage during the trial tended to side with the prosecutors, and often singled out the Church of Satan as the culprit. This led Zeena to volunteer to serve as the Church of Satan's first spokesperson.<ref>{{cite episode|series=KJTV| title = KJTV Interviews Zeena LaVey | location = Los Angeles, California | airdate = 1987}}</ref> In a September 2011 interview, Zeena recalled,
{{quote|In 1985, a US news show called ''[[20/20 (U.S. TV series)|20/20]]'' accused The Satanic Bible of being responsible for child daycare Satanic ritual abuse, allegations which were new then. ... I called my father and asked him what his media strategy would be to deal with this catastrophe. Nothing. He didn't care. As far as he was concerned it didn't concern him. It wasn't anything he needed to worry about. He certainly wasn't going out in public to do anything about it. He admitted that many media sources had already contacted him and he was just going to ignore it until it went away. I tried to convince him that this would only get worse if he didn't respond and that he really needed to get someone to answer calls quickly or it would be taken as an admission of guilt or suspicion. Finally he admitted he had no one to deal with interviews or media. I offered to help ''temporarily'' until he found someone. This was not what I'd intended to do with my life, I had other plans.<ref>{{cite web|title=Nikolas & Zeena Schreck original interview for Obsküre Magazine Sept 2011|url=http://www.obskuremag.net/articles/nikolas-zeena-schreck/}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Interview with Zeena Schreck from Obsküre Magazine [in English] by Maxime Lachaud, September 2011|url=http://www.zeena.eu/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=99%3Ainterview-with-zeena-and-nikolas-schreck-from-obskuere-magazine-by-maxime-lachaud-september-2011&catid=41&Itemid=57}}</ref>}}
As the Church of Satan's spokesperson, Zeena appeared in nationally syndicated programs such as ''[[The Phil Donahue Show]]'', ''[[Nightline]] with [[Ted Koppel]]'', ''[[Entertainment Tonight]]'', ''[[The Late Show (1986 TV series)|The Late Show]]'' and ''[[Secrets & Mysteries]]''.<ref name="The First Family of Satanism">{{cite episode | title = "The First Family of Satanism" | location = Denver, Colorado| series= The First Family of Satanism | airdate = 1989}}</ref> She also appeared on the ''[[Sally (1983 TV series)|Sally Jessy Raphael Show]]'', alongside her husband, debating several Christians who were invited onto the program to expound their own religious views.<ref>{{cite episode| series= Sally Jessy Raphael Show | title = Sally Jessy Raphael | location = New York City, New York | airdate = 1989}}</ref> Internationally, she appeared in such media presentations as Italy's [[RAI|RAI Mixer]] show and Toronto's Industrial Video presentation dedicated to a compilation of Zeena's TV appearances, ending with a lengthy radio interview for CUIT.<ref>{{cite web|title=Ref. television appearances Z.Schreck website|url=http://www.zeena.eu/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=69&Itemid=83}}</ref>
She was also interviewed in a broadcast of "Devil Worship: Exposing Satan's Underground" released by Geraldo Rivera in 1988.<ref>{{cite episode | title = Devil Worship: Exposing Satan's Underground | location = Los Angeles, California | series = Geraldo| airdate = October 22, 1988}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=The New Satanists|url=http://www.zeena.eu/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=105%3Athe-new-satanists-by-gini-graham-scott-and-linda-blood-1994&catid=41&Itemid=57|work=The Official Zeena Schreck Website|publisher=Zeena|accessdate=26 July 2012|author=Gini Graham Scott, Linda Blood|pages=76–77|year=1994}}</ref> Zeena sat alongside Michael A. Aquino (Temple of Set founder/High Priest), and repeatedly denied the rumors circulating at the time that the Church of Satan was in any way involved with ritual abuse. She also called the testimony of claimants involved into question, asking them rhetorically why, if people were being forced to give birth to babies for sacrificial rituals, no remains had ever been found.
In 1989, Anton LaVey's 1971 book ''The Compleat Witch, or What to Do When Virtue Fails'' was reprinted as ''[[The Satanic Witch]]'', with an introduction by Zeena. She toured the U.S. promoting her father's work in his absence, as he was no longer interested in making media appearances.<ref>{{cite web|title=KFI-AM 640 Radio Interview with Z. Schreck promoting The Satanic Witch|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0nGW6VrrM4Q}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Three volume set of Z. Schreck radio interviews spanning the U.S.|url=http://www.zeena.eu/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=75%3Aqzeena-lavey-radio-interviews-three-volume-setq&catid=36&Itemid=81}}</ref> Most of the appearances were made at the behest of the Church of Satan as its spokesperson.<ref name="The First Family of Satanism"/>
In 1989, while promoting the book, Zeena appeared with her then husband [[Nikolas Schreck]] (not a member of the COS) in an interview with [[televangelist]] [[Bob Larson]], during which they both refuted any Satanic criminal ties, and pressed Larson on his own ideals, stating that it was hypocritical of him to endorse such claims by Christians, pointing out the Christian background of many criminals, and violent acts within Christian history, such as the crusades.<ref name="The First Family of Satanism"/>
Zeena's Interview on KJTV with Tony Valdez, 1990, was the last interview she granted as public representative and High Priestess of the Church of Satan before resigning.<ref>{{cite web|title=Network Awesome program listing for Zeena Schreck/Tony Valdez Interview - Category "Talk Show: The First Family of Satanism"|url=http://networkawesome.com/2013-3-18/talk-show-the-first-family-of-satanism}}</ref><ref name="tony valdez youtube">{{cite web|title=1990 Zeena Schreck Interview on KJTV with Tony Valdez|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cDNwdcKdboQ}}</ref>
In a March 2013 interview televised by Network Awesome, Zeena spoke for the first time on camera about her experiences with media during the "Satanic Panic" years.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hurX8Tp3Mys|title=Zeena Schreck - March 18, 2013 televised interview by Network Awesome|first=|last=ZeenaSchreckOfficial|date=18 March 2013|publisher=|via=YouTube}}</ref>
Zeena was also in regular contact with law enforcement agencies and personnel, including Detective Patrick Metoyer of the LAPD<ref name="tony valdez youtube" /> and Robert D. Hicks, law-enforcement specialist with the Virginia Department of Criminal Justice Services and author of several precedent-setting treatises<ref>{{cite web|title=Cult Crime Network listing for Robert D. Hicks citing writings from the time Hicks was in dialog with Zeena.|url=http://www.holysmoke.org/report/62.htm}}</ref> including ''In Pursuit of Satan: The Police and The Occult''. ''In Pursuit of Satan'' began the wave of authoritative reports debunking the Satanic Panic. Much of what Hicks gleaned from Zeena's dialogs with him was included in this treatise. Prior to Zeena's dialogs and meetings with government agencies, police and law enforcement had only a very limited knowledge of Satanism. In 1992, the FBI issued an official report refuting the criminal conspiracy theories of this time.<ref>{{cite web|title=1992 FBI Report on Satanic Ritual Abuse, Kenneth V. Lanning|url=http://www.culteducation.com/reference/satanism/satanism1.html}}</ref>
===Leaving the Church of Satan, 1990===
In 1990, she resigned from the Church of Satan and renounced [[LaVeyan Satanism]]. According to Zeena's official web site, "In the process of defending the Church of Satan from these unfounded claims in the U.S. mass media, Zeena's media appearances attracted a new upsurge of membership to the formerly moribund organization even as she began to question and ultimately reject the self-centered philosophy she promoted. As she toured the United States on behalf of the Church of Satan, Zeena's crisis of faith reached its highpoint when she learned that most of her father's self-created legend was based on lies and that many of his works were plagiarized. When jealousy and spite motivated Anton LaVey and his administrator [[Blanche Barton|Densley-Barton]] to actually endanger Zeena's life, she could no longer continue to cover up her progenitor's true character in good conscience. This behind the scenes tension should be kept in mind when viewing or hearing Zeena's interviews from that time."<ref>{{cite web|title=1990 Zeena Schreck Interview collection|url=http://www.zeena.eu/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=75%3Aqzeena-lavey-radio-interviews-three-volume-setq&catid=36&Itemid=81}}</ref>
According to Zeena's homepage, remaining members of the Church of Satan and the LaVey family "reacted to her resignation by indulging in a typical cult-like character assassination campaign against her."<ref name="zeena webpage"/> Particularly active in the hostility against Zeena were [[Blanche Barton]],<ref>{{cite web|title=Blanche Barton letter on Zeena Schreck to the Village Voice|url=http://www.villagevoice.com/2002-08-27/specials/letters/}}</ref> [[Peter H. Gilmore]], [[Peggy Nadramia]], [[Boyd Rice]],<ref>{{cite web|title=Boyd Rice's official website|url=http://www.boydrice.com/interviews/}}</ref> [[Lisa Crystal Carver]], Daniel Ignace Kapelovitz,<ref name="bizarre interview">{{cite web|title=Bizarre Magazine, May 2005 interview with Zeena's son and daughter-in-law Stanton and Szandora LaVey by Boyd Rice music producer Daniel Kapelovitz|url=http://www.bizarremag.com/film-and-music/interviews/1809/stanton_lavey.html}}</ref> Larry Wessel,<ref>{{cite web|title=Example in content of Larry Wessel's documentary of Boyd Rice, Iconoclast, 2010 WesselMania|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1827439/}}</ref> Stanton and Szandora LaVey.
After her renunciation of the Church of Satan, Zeena Schreck severed use of her born name "LaVey" and legally changed her last name, for all official matters, to "Schreck". In a December 30, 1990 open letter to Michael A. Aquino of the [[Temple of Set]], she stated: "In light of all of the factors herein, I also officially severed my given surname [LaVey] and now prefer to be known only as Zeena. As I feel naturally aristocratic, I also have no need for the empty titles of Magistra or High Priestess that have been bandied about and fought over."<ref>{{cite web|title=Letter from Zeena LaVey to Michael Aquino|url=http://www.skeptictank.org/files/mys5/zeena.htm|work=Skeptic Tank Files|publisher=The Skeptic Tank|accessdate=26 July 2012|author=Zeena LaVey|date=30 December 1990}}</ref>
Since then, she does not accept correspondence addressed to "Zeena LaVey," "Zeena LaVey-Schreck", or any variant using the name LaVey.<ref>{{cite web|title=Contact:The Official Zeena Schreck Website|url=http://www.zeena.eu/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=84&Itemid=59|work=The Official Zeena Schreck Website|publisher=Zeena|accessdate=26 July 2012}}</ref>
===Temple of Set=== Zeena began to pursue ancient religious practices relating to the Egyptian god Seth and Sethianism. She has stated, "While I was residing in Vienna, I visited a museum where a Sethian altar lives. It was there that I had a very profound experience that enabled me to clearly see the course for my future."[40] At the time, she was also practicing traditional tantra and yoga. Her experiences within those two systems, as well as her central role and life's experience in other occult and esoteric milieux, would contribute considerably to the content of her book ''Demons of the Flesh'', co-authored with Nikolas Schreck.<ref>{{cite web|title=Review of Demons of the Flesh JAN 21, 2003 AT 6:01 AM (UPDATED FEB 16, 2015)|url=http://www.nypress.com/-demons-of-the-flesh/|website=nypress.com|publisher=New York Press}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=[ ... ]residing in Vienna, I visited a museum where a Sethian altar lives|url=https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/yv53ex/beelzebubs-daughter-0000175-v19n4|website=www.vice.com|publisher=Vice Magazine}}</ref>
In 1997, Zeena and co-guest Nikolas Schreck once again debated Christian Minister Bob Larson. This time she did not represent Satanism but rather Sethianism, though the interview was titled "Showdown With Satanism".<ref>{{cite web|title=Showdown with Satanism|url=https://www.amazon.com/Showdown-Satanism-Bob-Larson/dp/B001O0VW98|website=amazon.com|publisher=Bob Larson Ministries}}</ref> At the time she was III° Priestess of Set.
In 2002 Zeena became High Priestess of the Temple of Set.{{citation needed|date=April 2018}}
===Sethian Liberation Movement=== The Sethian Liberation Movement was founded on November 8, 2002, after Zeena Schreck resigned from the Temple of Set with four Masters of the Temple of Set (one Master, Magister Michael Kelly, was also a member of the corporate Board of Directors for the California non-profit organization The Temple of Set).<ref name="dis info mag" /> Details of the departure were explained in a letter dated November 8, 2002 from the newly departed Temple of Set Council of Nine member to an Adept IIº member regarding the events leading to Zeena's resignation and the founding of the Storm, later renamed the Sethian Liberation Movement.<ref>{{cite web|title=Letter regarding Zeena's resignation from the Temple of Set Council of Nine|url=http://www.zeena.eu/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=102%3Aletter-from-a-temple-of-set-council-of-nine-member-regarding-the-events-leading-to-zeenas-resignation-and-the-founding-of-the-storm-later-the-sethian-liberation-movement-november-8-2002&catid=41&Itemid=57|work=The Official Zeena Schreck Website|publisher=Zeena|accessdate=26 July 2012|author=Michael|date=8 November 2002}}</ref>
Shortly after Zeena Schreck resigned from the Temple of Set, a [[Disinformation (company)|Disinfo]] listing for the Temple of Set from December 17, 2002 under the heading: 2002 Schism: The Storm Awakens reported, "High Priest Don Webb stepped down, and, on 9 September 2002, was succeeded by High Priestess Zeena Schreck. Six weeks after the Helsinki Conclave (September 2002), Zeena, Magister Aaron Besson, Magister Nikolas Schreck and Magister Michael Kelly all resigned on 8 November 2002. Four Priests Alfred Rodriguez, Kevin Rockhill, Jared Davison and Richard Gavin also resigned. Temple of Set sources have claimed that eighteen Initiates have resigned while others have estimated the number at closer to sixty (including several Orders, Elements, and members of the Adept and Setian degrees)."<ref name="dis info mag">{{cite web|title=The Temple of Set|url=http://old.disinfo.com/archive/pages/dossier/id163/pg1/index.html|work=Disinformation|publisher=The Disinformation Company Ltd.|accessdate=26 July 2012|author=Alex Burns|date=17 December 2002}}</ref>
In one of the Sethian Liberation Movement's earliest public Frequently Answered Questions documents released, Disinfo referenced it in their post covering the Temple of Seth/Storm schism: " ...  [the] document defines the new and as-yet unnamed group as  ... a loose confederation of Setian Teachers and Students, an alliance of Orders." The group has eschewed the Temple's administrative and non-profit structure, as well as its degree system and titles. "We work together through mutual respect and interest, not through any organizational limitations or restrictions", the FAQ document states. Finally, its founders have sought to avoid the "magical society" structure of post-Theosophy groups: the confederation is "an ongoing Magical Working in which we may participate, a living, dynamic and evolving thing."<ref>{{cite web|title=Chapter "A Love Cult" p249-251|url=http://www.parareligion.ch/schreck.htm|work=Demons of the Flesh The Complete Guide to Left Hand Sex Magic|publisher=Nikolas and Zeena Schreck|accessdate=26 July 2012|author=Nikolas and Zeena Schreck}}</ref>
Zeena's homepage states, "Drawing on her own triumph over these and other dysfunctional family experiences, Zeena, a professional bereavement counsellor, founded The Sethian Liberation Movement's public outreach program PHOENIX to help others in similar situations."<ref name="zeena webpage"/> It explains that "Since 2004 Phoenix provides spiritual healing for victims of exploitative pseudo-religious organizations, former gang members, whistle-blowing ex-employees of corrupt corporations and governmental agencies, relatives of the violently mentally ill, and survivors of all forms of institutional abuse, including secretly abused children and spouses of prominent personalities."
==Other media appearances== [[File:Zeena Schreck, Berlin 1989.jpg|thumbnail|Zeena at the German premiere of ''[[Charles Manson Superstar]]'', a film she co-produced and narrated, in 1989]] Zeena's website states: "Preferring to allow her work to speak for itself and indifferent to public opinion, Zeena has granted only a very few interviews since 1993."<ref>{{cite web|title=Zeena Schreck official Website/About Zeena/Interviews|url=http://www.zeena.eu/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=87&Itemid=57}}</ref>
In 2004 Zeena and Nikolas Schreck spoke about their book ''Demons of the Flesh'' on ''The Devil's Advocate'' radio show. In that interview, Zeena also spoke about the Storm (before it had been renamed Sethian Liberation Movement) and its incorporation of the tantric left way practices she writes of in her book.<ref name="Devil's Advocate Radio Show">{{cite episode|title=Interview with Nikolas and Zeena Schreck|series=Devil's Advocate Radio Show|airdate=2004}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yNpT032OvNc|title=Nikolas and Zeena Schreck interview with Devil's Advocate Radio Show part 1 of 4|first=|last=Styxhexenhammer666|date=7 December 2011|publisher=|via=YouTube}}</ref>
In December 2011 Zeena Schreck spoke about the Sethian Liberation Movement on ''Nightwatch Radio'' while also promoting two of her short fiction stories, ''A Short History of Buddhism in Berlin'' and ''Lost and Found: A Fairy Tale of Sethian Awakening'', in the literary journal ''Beatdom'' released December 2011. According to the ''Nightwatch'' interview Zeena Schreck states that the Sethian Liberation Movement (SLM) is not membership based nor a 'group' seeking to fill dues quotas, or something to join but rather a practice.
In December 2012, Zeena Schreck was invited back to Nightwatch Radio.<ref>{{cite web|title=Zeena Schreck Nightwatch Interview Dec. 11, 2012|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cYBv2_ujDL4}}</ref> This time, promoting the 2012 Radio Werewolf release of ''The Vinyl Solution - Analog Artifacts: Ritual Instrumentals and Undercover Versions'' CD, the first authorized Radio Werewolf release in 20 years,<ref name="zeena.eu radio werewolf">{{cite web|title=Radio Werewolf's The Vinyl Solution - Analog Artifacts: Ritual Instrumentals and Undercover Versions - CD|url=http://www.zeena.eu/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=92&Itemid=85}}</ref> and ''Beatdom'''s Crime issue #12 featuring a vintage portrait of Zeena on the cover and her theatre monologue, "Night Shift, Richmond Station".<ref>{{cite web|title=Beatdom website ref. to issue #12 "What to expect from Beatdom"|url=http://www.beatdom.com/?p=2172}}</ref>
On December 10, 2012, Zeena curated a stream of videos for [[Network Awesome|Network Awesome's]] Live Music Show, with audio and visual clips arranged in an autobiographical manner.<ref>{{cite web|title=Network Awesome Live Music Show/Zeena Schreck Dec. 10, 2012|url=http://networkawesome.com/2012-12-10/live-music-show-zeena-schreck}}</ref>
On March 18, 2013 Network Awesome's daily program opened with an exclusive original production featuring Zeena Schreck's first one-on-one televised interview in 22 years,<ref>{{cite web |title=Network Awesome Original Production:Talk Show Interview with Zeena Schreck by Artist Jen Ray |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hurX8Tp3Mys}}</ref> conducted by artist Jen Ray.<ref>{{cite web |title=Jen Ray Artist website |url=http://jenrayart.com/Interview-with-Zeena-Schreck}}</ref> Network Awesome spotlighted Zeena with a full day of programming, referencing various facets of her life.<ref>{{cite web|title=March 18th, 2013 Network Awesome's daily program spotlighting Zeena Schreck|url=http://networkawesome.com/2013-3-18/talk-show-zeena-schreck}}</ref> Other features in the day's program included archival interviews of Zeena and documentaries relating to her current spiritual pursuits and practices.
In 2016, a mock [[conspiracy theory]] in a vein similar to that of the [[Ted Cruz–Zodiac meme]] arose online, conflating Zeena with popular musical artist [[Taylor Swift]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mashable.com/2016/09/10/taylor-swift-satanist-clone-zeena-lavey/#VC7ULgqdnmqw|title=Here's why the theory that Taylor Swift is a satanist clone absolutely checks out|first=Tricia|last=Gilbride|publisher=}}</ref>
==Music and performance art== [[File:Zeena Schreck 1989 Berlin Independence Days Music Festival.jpg|thumbnail|Schreck at the Berlin Independence Days Music Festival, 1989.]]
===The 8/8/88 Rally=== On August 8, 1988, a large gathering converged on the [[Strand Theater (San Francisco)|Strand Theater]] in San Francisco for the film debut of a 'mockumentary' about [[Charles Manson]]. The event, planned and carried out by [[Nikolas Schreck]], was the largest single gathering of this kind in history{{citation needed|date=January 2018}}. Zeena spoke at the beginning of the rally and a film of her baptism was played. In a 2011 interview with Zeena for French music magazine ''Obsküre'', she stated that 8-8-88 "would be the only performance that Nikolas, Evil Wilhelm [the original Radio Werewolf percussionist], and I ever performed live together. That marked the transition point spanning three phases of Radio Werewolf: 1) the Nikolas Schreck/Evil Wilhelm collaboration, 2) the solo Nikolas Schreck phase, and 3) the Nikolas Schreck/Zeena collaboration."<ref>{{cite web|title=Interview with Nikolas and Zeena Schreck from Obsküre Magazine by Maxime Lachaud, September 2011|url=http://www.zeena.eu/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=99%3Ainterview-with-zeena-and-nikolas-schreck-from-obskuere-magazine-by-maxime-lachaud-september-2011&catid=41&Itemid=57}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Original French version of cited Interview with Zeena and Nikolas Schreck in Obsküre Magazine.|url=http://www.obskuremag.net/articles/nikolas-zeena-schreck/}}</ref> Also featured were [[Boyd Rice|NON]], [[Adam Parfrey|Amok Press]] and [[Kris Force]], a musician who at the time owned the Strand Theater. Geraldo Rivera's "Devil Worship: Exposing Satan's Underground" film crew filmed the event, as well as interviews with all involved, to use for the network special.<ref>{{cite web|title=Footage at 8-8-88 filmed for Geraldo's "Devil Worship:Exposing Satan's Underground", 1988, with accompanying interviews.|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vx0kRUOzrxI}}</ref><ref>{{cite episode|series=No Other Radio Network|title=September 22 Broadcast|location=San Francisco, California|airdate=September 22, 1988}}</ref>
===Radio Werewolf=== {{Main|Radio Werewolf}}
From 1988–1993, Zeena was co-director of the experimental musical project [[Radio Werewolf]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Artist Description: Between 1988-1993 Zeena was composer, vocalist, musician and graphic designer for the sonic magical musical project Radio Werewolf.|url=http://13.performa-arts.org/artists/zeena-schreck}}</ref> She served as composer, vocalist, musician and graphic designer on the Radio Werewolf recordings "Songs for the End of the World", "The Lightning and the Sun", "Bring Me The Head of Geraldo Rivera", "These Boots Were Made for Walking", and "Love Conquers All." Her performances were exclusively European-based at that time.<ref>{{cite web|title=Zeena|url=http://www.discogs.com/artist/Zeena|work=Discogs|publisher=Discogs|accessdate=26 July 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=All Recordings Credits for Zeena Schreck listed on her website|url=http://www.zeena.eu/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=89&Itemid=54}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Published Illustrations|url=http://www.zeena.eu/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=86&Itemid=88|work=The Official Zeena Schreck Website|publisher=Zeena|accessdate=26 July 2012}}</ref>
In 2012, Radio Werewolf released ''The Vinyl Solution - Analog Artifacts: Ritual Instrumentals and Undercover Versions'' Compact Disc, the first authorized Radio Werewolf release in 20 years.<ref name="zeena.eu radio werewolf"/>
In 2016, [[Classic Rock (magazine)|Classic Rock]] magazine ranked Radio Werewolf #4 on their 'The 25 weirdest bands of all time' list, stating: "Formed during the height of 'Satanic Panic' hysteria in mid-80's America, Radio Werewolf was once considered 'the most dangerous band in the world', largely due to the notoriety of their vocalist, Zeena Schreck[ ... ]".<ref>{{cite web|title=Classic Rock: The 24 weirdest bands of all time|url=http://teamrock.com/feature/2016-06-28/the-25-weirdest-bands-of-all-time}}</ref> In 2016, The Top Tens Most Satanic Bands listed Radio Werewolf, "Yes!, Since when does Heavy Metal have to be the only satanic music. Why not dark organ Gothic/Deathrock."<ref>{{cite web|title=The Top Tens: Music: Most Satanic Bands: Radio Werewolf|url=http://www.thetoptens.com/most-satanic-bands/page4.asp}}</ref>
==Solo music career== [[File:Zeena Schreck Wave-Gotik-Treffen Music festival May 23, 2015 Leipzig.JPG|thumb|Schreck with [[John Murphy (musician)|John Murphy]] and Cory Vielma at the Wave-Gotik-Treffen Festival in May 2015]]
===Performa 13, New York===
On November 8, 2013, the visual art performance biennial ''[[Performa (performance festival)|Performa]]'' presented Zeena accompanied by New York musician [[Hisham Bharoocha]] (first percussion) and Danish musician Anders Hermund (second percussion), for a vocal based work that tapped into the ritual use of sacred syllables from [[Vajrayana]], [[Shaktism]] and Sethian-Typhonian left-way [[tantra|tantric]] practices, "originating from emptiness, gradually transforming into a sound and voice collage on a stage set design by Frank Haines."<ref>{{cite web|title=Frank Haines & Zeena Schreck, Live From the Eye of the Storm - Event description|url=http://13.performa-arts.org/event/frank-haines-zeena-schreck}}</ref> This was Zeena's first solo performance in her native country since her [[Expatriate|expatriation]] to Europe in 1990.
David Sanderson described the event, "Jingling bells and padded footsteps echoed in the darkness. The curtains silently parted, dramatically revealing an electrified, vermilion environment. Dead center, with hands held in the Mudra position, stood the seemingly twenty-foot tall goddess Zeena. With a painted gong behind her, Bharoocha and Hermund adorned her sides. Bharoocha lit incense that swept through the audience as Zeena's commanding gaze pierced us all (everyone I talked to after the show swore she was staring directly at them)."<ref>{{cite web|title=The Left Hand Path Leads to Performa 13 by David Sanderson|url=http://bushwickdaily.com/2013/11/the-left-hand-path-leads-to-performa-13/}}</ref>
===Wave-Gotik-Treffen music festival===
On May 23, 2015, after a 24-year retreat from musical performances, Zeena made her official return to music in Europe, now as a solo artist, at the [[Wave-Gotik-Treffen]] festival in Leipzig, Germany.<ref>{{cite web|title=Heathen Harvest report: Zeena Schreck Performs a Typhonian Tantric Ritual Soundscape at the Egyptian Museum, Leipzig|url=https://heathenharvest.org/2015/04/18/zeena-schreck-performs-a-typhonian-tantric-ritual-soundscape-at-the-egyptian-museum-leipzig/}}</ref> The concert, held amid "the sacred, magically charged ancient artifacts housed in Leipzig's Egyptian Museum (at the [[Leipzig University]])," was a unique ritual soundscape which Zeena composed especially for the theme of that environment.<ref>{{cite web|title=KPopStarz report: Legendary Magic Practitioner Zeena Schreck Returns To European Music Scene For First Time In 24 Years This Saturday, May 23|url=http://www.kpopstarz.com/articles/203000/20150519/zeena-schreck-new-music.htm}}</ref> She was accompanied by Cory Vielma and [[John Murphy (musician)|John Murphy]]. This was John Murphy's second to last performance.<ref>{{cite web|title=Zeena Schreck - WGT Performance with John Murphy 2015|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P7EYjmcjsbU}}</ref> Having suffered a long illness, John Murphy died less than five months after this concert.<ref>{{cite web|title=Zeena's Retrospective of John Murphy's music broadcast on Network Awesome.|url=http://www.zeenaschreck.com/blog/john-murphy-retrospecitve-curated-by-zeena-for-network-awesome}}</ref> In accordance to Murphy's wishes, Zeena conducted the traditional Tibetan Buddhist ceremony for the [[Phowa|passing of consciousness]] as he died.<ref>{{cite web|title=Zeena's Memorial to John Murphy|url=http://www.zeenaschreck.com/blog/rip-music-legend-john-murphy}}</ref> In 2016, a tribute to John Murphy as a 3CD compilation set entitled "All My Sins Remembered - The Sonic Worlds of John Murphy" was released by The Epicurean record label. On it, a live track from Zeena's WGT concert, featuring Murphy's electronic-percussion is included.<ref>{{cite web|title=All My Sins Remembered - The Sonic Worlds of John Murphy|url=https://epicureanescapism.bandcamp.com/album/all-my-sins-remembered-the-sonic-worlds-of-john-murphy|website=The Epicurean "All My Sins Remembered"}}</ref> The CD booklet also features cover portrait of Murphy by Zeena.
